label: Description
value: Unlined bed cover make up of three lengths of printed fabric with white fringe sewn to four sides. Pattern composed oftwo vertical elements: the wider a tear drop shape with bent top and flowers and the other two twined ribbons with a flower pattern. Background is light brown. Two groups of verticals are half dropped to fill width of fabric but the pattern is wider than this fabric. Unit of repeat: 35 cm. (13 3/4") high x 23.5 cm. (9 1/4") wide.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave; woven tape with weft fringe

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (including fringe): 193 x 189 cm (6 ft. 4 in. x 6 ft. 2 7/16 in.) Repeat H x W: 35 x 23.5 cm (13 3/4 x 9 1/4 in.)

label: Description
value: Grid of scrolls and floral medallions ecnlosing striped so as to simulate warp printing. A large misture of pattern sources. Blue, 2 greens, pink, yellow, orange and brown on white.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: a. Warp:229cm (90 1/2in.). Weft: 78cm (30 3/4in.). b. Warp:230.5cm (91in.). Weft: 78cm (30 3/4in.) Both selvedges present on both pieces.

label: Description
value: Alternation of two stripes. The wider stripe scrolls and flowers in red, gold, green and black on white. The narrower stripe scrolls in black and gold on purple.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: a. Warp: 200cm (78 3/4in.). Weft: 71cm (28in.). b. Warp: 199cm (78 1/2in.). Weft: 71cm (28in.). Both selvedges present in both pieces.

value: a) Green paper with stylized widely spaced floral stripe; b) Matching frieze - "crown"

value: Small-scaled green, blue, brown and maroon checked pattern on mustard ground, with black overstripe.

value: Dots, wavering vertical pin stripes in black, printed over foliage on tree boughs in shades of green, blue, ochre, outlined in maroon, on green ground.

value: Gift of Historical Society of Cheshire County

label: Description
value: Stylized art nouveau foliate pattern in ochre on lighter shade of mustard- colored paper, ungrounded.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Historical Society of Cheshire County

label: Description
value: Rococo-revival scrollwork pattern in green and metallic gold on a mica beige ground. Paper support has embossed horizontal ribbing.

label: Provenance
value: Installed in 1895 by Stanford White in large sitting room at Rokeby, Barrytown, New York.

label: Description
value: Bright red and gray flowers, with buds, on vines. Printed on a polished or satin white ground.

label: Description
value: Group of four wallpaper fragments, each cut in the shape of a doll dress. Were among the toys of Willie Banning who died at age 4 in 1864. Papers appear to date from early 1860s; in shades of blue, brown and gray.

label: Description
value: Cockatoos and flowers printed in white, pink, red and green on yellow ground

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed, design mounted on modern paper

label: Description
value: Faded rust red damask with vertically symmetrical pattern offset rows of plants with leaves forming a loose grid enclosing rayed blossom-like medallion. Alternating rows have plant variations.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 59.5 x 55 cm (23 7/16 x 21 5/8 in.) Repeat H: 18.5 cm (7 5/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Piece of crewel embroidery in colored wool yarns with scattered motifs in a grid arrangement. The motifs do not repeat in a regular manner but alternate a floral motif (eight different ones, sometimes facing in different directions) with an animal or bird motif (eight different ones). Different colors are used when a motif is repeated.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: crewel wool on cotton Technique: embroidered in chain stitch (needle-made), knots and satin stitch on 2/2 twill weave

label: Description
value: Piece of crewel embroidery colored yarns with scattered motifs in a grid arrangement.  The motifs do not repeat in a regular manner but alternate a florral motif [8 different ones, sometmes facing in different directions] with an animal or bird motif [8 different ones]   Different colors are used when a motif is repeated.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: crewel wool on cotton Technique: Uncounted stitches chain stitch [done with a needle] and knots and satin stitch on a 2/2 twill foundation.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. H. P. Davison

label: Description
value: The inscription is surrounded by very stylized isolated plant motifs, framed by a narrow border of small diamonds, and a deeper zigzag floral vine border.

value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in cross and stem stitches on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 27.3 x 33.7 cm (10 3/4 x 13 1/4 in.) framed dimensions

label: Provenance
value: By 1974, Mrs. H. P. Davidson 1974, Cooper-Hewitt Museum

label: Description
value: Basket of strawberries, wheat and flowers on a square pedestal in several colors. Gilded wood frame.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on silk foundation with linen lining Technique: embroidered in long floating running stitches on plain weave

label: Dimensions
value: Frame H x W: 33 x 27.9 cm (13 x 11 in.)

label: Description
value: Painted and embroidered picture of a young boy in a white dress with a blue sash and carrying a large black hat, standing in a landscape. Framed with black eglomisé glass in oval form, with gold stars in corners.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery and paint on a silk foundation Technique: embroidered in stem stitch on a plain weave foundation; hands and face painted

label: Dimensions
value: Frame H x W: 35.6 x 28.6 cm (14 x 11 1/4 in.)

label: Description
value: Sash with identical ten inch high embroidered border at each end. The border consists of two five-inch wide repeats of a flowering plant in shades of red, green, blue and metallic silver. The lower border, about one inch high, is a three-inch repeat of a curving vine.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk on cotton Technique: uncounted stitches; satin and double running stitches on plain weave; foundation has a crepe effect due to over twisted z-spun yarns used for warp and weft

label: Description
value: Two ends of an embroidered cover or sash, each with four units arranged in a square repeat (two units high, two units wide) of a flowering plant on a mound. In the center is a small basket of flowers. All in shades of red, blue, green and metallic gold.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk on cotton Technique: double running and satin stitches on plain weave

label: Description
value: Very fine blue vertically curving branch and ribbon enclosing small multi-color sprigs of flowers on a blue textured background.  Four repeats across width of fabric.  Length of fabric placed side-by-side continue repeat.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain weave patterned by floats of alternate wefts; floats of discontinuous supplementary wefts, and a set of supplementary warps to create a textured background

label: Description
value: Square grid in which a four pointed star and rosette alternate. They are bobbin lace made to look like gauze. Three knotted tassels are at each end. Intended to look like reticella.

label: Description
value: White-on-white embroidered shawl in a sheer fabric with an Indian style border of four floral motifs in large boteh or paisley shapes at each end. Sparsely dotted field with embroidered scalloped edge capped with flowers on all four sides.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: buttonhole, satin and stem stitches on plain weave; deflected element work

label: Description
value: Delicate multicolored flower clusters form intersecting diagonal bands across the surface of the tablecover. Bobbin lace edging decorates longest edges while fringe decorates shortest edges.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen Technique: satin and outline stitches on plain weave; cardwoven fringe; bobbin lace

label: Description
value: Scrolling vines and leaves cut from a foundation fabric form a repeating pattern derived from an ogee grid. Bobbin lace on all four sides.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: cutwork on plain weave; bobbin lace

label: Description
value: a) Small horizontal rectangle of "sky" once hung above a door;

value: Gift of Mrs. Edward L. Nesbitt

label: Description
value: Feathery white and blue leaves with staggered round floral clusters in shades of blue.

label: Provenance
value: Delafield, Hope & Linker; 1974: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Pastel blue striping, outlined in brighter blue, alternates with reserved stripes of the shiny white satin ground. Block printed tiny flowers in blue with foliage in ochre and brown, over white stripes.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed, mechanically applied striping, machine made paper

label: Description
value: A floral striped paper. Wide bandings of wavy gray lines alternate with one banding of swagged floral garlands, one of rose sprigs over stripes formed of gray dashes. Blue dots, stripes, leaves, pink flowers, green foliage, on a white ground

label: Description
value: On ungrounded off-white paper, imitation moire effect is printed in gray, with a wide floral stripe in two shades of pink, two shades of lavender, blue, two shades of green ochre, and black, alternating with a narrow stripe, a twisted lavender ribbon dotted with ochre bandings along the edge interrupted by tiny sprigs of two pink roses at approximately 4 inch intervals.
